Adversarial example attack endangers the mobile edge systems such as vehicles and drones that adopt deep neural networks for visual sensing. This paper presents {\em Sardino}, an active and dynamic defense approach that renews the inference ensemble at run time to develop security against the adaptive adversary who tries to exfiltrate the ensemble and construct the corresponding effective adversarial examples. By applying consistency check and data fusion on the ensemble's predictions, Sardino can detect and thwart adversarial inputs. Compared with the training-based ensemble renewal, we use HyperNet to achieve {\em one million times} acceleration and per-frame ensemble renewal that presents the highest level of difficulty to the prerequisite exfiltration attacks. We design a run-time planner that maximizes the ensemble size in favor of security while maintaining the processing frame rate. Beyond adversarial examples, Sardino can also address the issue of out-of-distribution inputs effectively. This paper presents extensive evaluation of Sardino's performance in counteracting adversarial examples and applies it to build a real-time car-borne traffic sign recognition system. Live on-road tests show the built system's effectiveness in maintaining frame rate and detecting out-of-distribution inputs due to the false positives of a preceding YOLO-based traffic sign detector.

Rapid developments of the electronic information industry promote energy usages of cooling system in data centers to be paid extensive attention, especially in the tropical environment. The study experimentally conducts the key issues and assessments of energy-saving operations of tropical data center at system and component levels from the perspectives of thermodynamics, economics, and thermoeconomics. Comprehensive assessments of supply air temperature, outdoor air temperature, and operation modes in tropical data center are discussed and compared. Operation modes of compression vary with the setpoints of supply air temperature. The alternate operation easily appears in multiple compressors, inevitably increasing the exergy loss & destruction of data centers. As supply air temperature rises from 20 C to 32 C, average hourly energy cost of cooling system decreases 37.8%. Also, high supply air temperature and low refrigerant charges have significant exergy costing advantages over resisting the impacts of outdoor air temperature changes. Based on them, practical operation strategies for dynamic adjustment of supply air temperature have been proposed to cope with impacts of the tropical high-temperature environment. The results reveal that the average energy savings values are 0.7%~ 2.8%, which provides the feasibility of making full use of outdoor conditions and indoor parameters.

The rapid development of the electronic information industry promotes the energy usage of the cooling system in data centers (DCs) to be paid extensive attention, especially in the tropical environment. The study experimentally conducts the key issues and assessments of energy-saving operations of the tropical data center (TDC) at system and component levels from the perspectives of thermodynamics, economics, and thermoeconomics. Comprehensive assessments of supply air temperature (SAT), outdoor air temperature (OAT), and operation modes in TDC are discussed and compared. The operation modes of compression vary with the setpoints of SAT. The alternate operation easily appears in multiple compressors, inevitably increasing the exergy loss & destruction of DCs. As the SAT increases from 20 C to 32 C, the average hourly energy cost of the cooling system decreases from SGD 3.7 to 2.3. Also, high SAT and low refrigerant charges have significant exergy costing advantages over resisting the impacts of OAT changes. Based on them, practical operation strategies for dynamic adjustment of SAT have been proposed to cope with the impacts of the tropical high-temperature environment. The results reveal that the average energy savings values are 0.7%~ 2.8%, which provides the feasibility of making full use of outdoor conditions and indoor parameters.
